target: Follow me and receive ’t.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Give me your arm.
target: Give me your arm.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Neighbors and friends, though we don’t have anyone for the bride and bridegroom’s places at the table, you know there’s nothing missing in the feast itself.
target: Neighbors and friends, though bride and bridegroom wants For to supply the places at the table, You know there wants no junkets at the feast.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s pretty well done, isn’t it?
target: Is ’t not well done?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No.
target: None, man.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good night, brother.
target: Brother, good night.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Look at my face.
target: Look in my face.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I see a woman may be made a fool of if she doesn’t have nerve enough to stand up for herself.
target: I see a woman may be made a fool If she had not a spirit to resist.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: When courage consumes reason, it destroys its only weapon.
target: When valor preys on reason, It eats the sword it fights with.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I figure that once he’s crippled me, I’ll beg by showing off my beatings.
target: Nay, I bear it on my shoulders as a beggar wont her brat, and I think when he hath lamed me, I shall beg with it from door to door.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Be quiet for a while.—Robin, take off his donkey head.—Titania, get the fairies to play some music, and make these five people sleep more soundly than humans have ever slept before.
target: Silence awhile.—Robin, take off this head.— Titania, music call, and strike more dead Than common sleep of all these five the sense.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please wear this ring.
target: Vouchsafe to wear this ring.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you do intend to live, then mourn.
target: If you will live, lament.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Indeed, my lord, the gloomy Jaques grieves over these deaths.
target: Come, shall we go and kill us venison?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m positively stuffed with air, I eat so much of it.
target: You cannot feed capons so.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Will you marry her?
target: Will you have her?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If I could shoot lightning bolts from my eyes, I can tell you who’d be on the ground.
target: If I had a thunderbolt in mine eye, I can tell who should down.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll drink later.
target: By and by.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, Caesar!
target: O Caesar!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let us leave everything and give our vineyards to the barbarous nation.
target: Let us quit all And give our vineyards to a barbarous people.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: They’re pretty busy in there.
target: They’re busy within.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why did you do that?
target: Why did you so?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Can’t you find a reason without my giving you one?
target: Could you not take some occasion without giving?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He hasn’t arrived yet.
target: He is not yet arrived.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You told me that you don’t salute at the court but kiss hands.
target: You told me you salute not at the court but you kiss your hands.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’d bet fourteen of my own teeth—but, I’m sorry to say, I only have four teeth—she’s not fourteen.
target: I’ll lay fourteen of my teeth—and yet, to my teen be it spoken, I have but four—she is not fourteen.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We’ll come with you, your Grace.
target: We wait upon your Grace.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: When the day comes, I’ll wish it were nighttime, so I could sleep with the legal expert’s clerk.
target: But were the day come, I should wish it dark, That I were couching with the doctor’s clerk.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is there any natural cause for hardening of the heart?
target: Is there any cause in nature that makes these hard hearts?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But I won’t attack a woman, even if she is a demon.
target: Howe'er thou art a fiend, A woman’s shape doth shield thee.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Poor lady, she’ll go crazy when she sees it’s missing.
target: Poor lady, she’ll run mad When she shall lack it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If that’s true, he won’t get it back by crying.
target: If he do, sure he cannot weep ’t back again.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Are you satisfied, Jew?
target: Art thou contented, Jew?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is she enclosed in silver, which is ten times less valuable than gold?
target: Or shall I think in silver she’s immured, Being ten times undervalued to tried gold?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your Majesty shall mock at me.
target: Your Majesty shall mock at me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, then I see you’ve been with  Who’s Queen Mab?
target: Oh, then, I see Queen Mab hath been with you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: For you, I give myself away and I’m ecstatic about the exchange.
target: I give away myself for you and dote upon the exchange.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: When the forked blue lightning seemed to break open the sky, I put myself right where I thought it would hit.
target: And when the cross blue lightning seemed to open The breast of heaven, I did present myself Even in the aim and very flash of it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why, so did you.
target: Why, so didst thou.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My sword and I will earn our place in history.
target: I and my sword will earn our chronicle.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Have you heard this, Cassio?
target: Do you hear, Cassio?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Are you going to write Antony about this?
target: Thou wilt write to Antony?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, very well, sir.
target: Ay, very well, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll lie here tonight.
target: Up with my tent!—Here will I lie tonight.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The whole time.
target: Most constantly.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Go away!
target: I’ll see no more.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hello, sir.
target: Save you, gentleman.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’d rather adopt a child than have one of my own.—Come here, Moor.
target: I had rather to adopt a child than get it.— Come hither, Moor.

target: What he hath lost, noble Macbeth hath won.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It would be hard, almost impossible.
target: Tis hard; almost impossible.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m afraid you’ve sold your own land to see other men’s.
target: I fear you have sold your own lands to see other men’s.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Where do you live, pretty young man?
target: Where dwell you, pretty youth?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hurry up, Robin, and make the night dark and cloudy.
target: Hie therefore, Robin, overcast the night.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: From under the earth.
target: Under the earth.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Call the numbskull back in here.
target: Call the clotpoll back.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, well, well.
target: Well, well, well.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Father, what’s the news?
target: Father, what news?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But enough about that.
target: Nothing extenuate, Nor set down aught in malice.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: How are you going to live?
target: How will you live?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Halt!
target: Stand!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That’s what made him crazy.
target: That hath made him mad.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What color is her hair?
target: Her hair, what color?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Get up, liar.
target: Arise, dissembler.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s a bet.
target: Tis done.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I thought I heard a voice cry, “Sleep no more!
target: Methought I heard a voice cry, “Sleep no more!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, it was just a dream.
target: Nay, this was but his dream.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, my lord, what do you mean by that?
target: Alack, my lord, what do you mean by that?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your life is stretched to its limit.
target: Nature in you stands on the very verge Of his confine.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come on, sir.
target: Come on, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If I could beg others to change their minds, begging would convince me, too.
target: If I could pray to move, prayers would move me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good-bye, good-bye, good-bye.
target: Adieu, adieu, adieu.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But Macbeth is.
target: But Macbeth is.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And when I’m king, remember to ask me for the earldom of Hereford and all the possessions that go with it, which my brother the king used to own.
target: And look when I am king, claim thou of me The earldom of Hereford, and all the moveables Whereof the king my brother was possessed.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: When I like the way you look, for God forbid your face be as ugly as your mask!
target: When I like your favor, for God defend the lute should be like the case!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: How’s the night going, boy?
target: How goes the night, boy?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If I live through this, I’ll be good to you.
target: If I do live, I will be good to thee.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: She’ll find out soon enough by one of our messengers how respectfully and kindly we plan to treat her.
target: She soon shall know of us, by some of ours, How honorable and how kindly we Determine for her, for Caesar cannot live To be ungentle.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Then come to my house tomorrow morning, and since you couldn’t be my son-in-law, be my nephew instead.
target: Tomorrow morning come you to my house, And since you could not be my son-in-law, Be yet my nephew.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But my hair looks good anyway, doesn’t it?
target: But it becomes me well enough, does ’t not?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good-bye.
target: Fare thee well.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Awake, my lords!
target: Up, my lords.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let me say “amen” quickly, before the devil comes in and stops my prayer—because here comes the devil, disguised as a Jew.
target: Let me say “Amen” betimes, lest the devil cross my prayer, for here he comes in the likeness of a Jew.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Tell him I’ve spoken to my husband on his behalf, and I think everything will be all right.
target: Tell him I have moved my lord on his behalf, and hope all will be well.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Pick up the corpses.
target: Take up the bodies.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Take some men and horses and go to her.
target: Take you some company, and away to horse.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This hard work would be boring and nasty to me, but I’m working for a mistress who makes me enjoy my labor.
target: This my mean task Would be as heavy to me as odious, but The mistress which I serve quickens what’s dead And makes my labors pleasures.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Someone knocks.
target: One knocks.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Travelers have never told lies, no matter what the fools at home accuse them of.
target: Travelers ne'er did lie, Though fools at home condemn 'em.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I don’t think a ridiculous Pyramus like that one deserves much moaning.
target: Methinks she should not use a long one for such a Pyramus.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If it’s sad to see a handsome man with a cheating wife, it’s a tragedy to see an ugly thug with a wife who’s faithful.
target: For, as it is a heartbreaking to see a handsome man loose-wived, so it is a deadly sorrow to behold a foul knave uncuckolded.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You couldn’t find a third like these two unless the devil himself turned into a Jew.
target: A third cannot be matched unless the devil himself turn Jew.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, let’s go on.
target: Well, again.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’re in a bad mood?
target: Moody?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Den it shall also content me.
target: Den it sall also content me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m growing a beard.
target: I have a beard coming.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What’s the matter?
target: What’s the matter?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Say it again—just one word, and my hand, which killed your lover out of love, will kill your far truer lover.
target: Speak it again and, even with the word, This hand, which for thy love did kill thy love, Shall for thy love kill a far truer love.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s time for us to stand guard.
target: We must to the watch.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, just lies, sir.
target: Slanders, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I order you to stop!
target: On thy life I charge thee, hold!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hopefully, your wedding day is only postponed.
target: This wedding day Perhaps is but prolonged.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Stay, lovely Helena.
target: Stay, gentle Helena.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I could not forget you, since I never saw you before in my life.
target: I could not forget you, for I never saw you before in all my life.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Did he ask about me?
target: Did he ask for me?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Back then, I called you “a poor, imitation queen,” a badly reproduced copy of what I was, a pretty prologue for the tragedy that was about to follow, a woman who was lifted high only to be hurled down to hell, a mother only teased with two beautiful children, who would soon die.

target: O Sisters three, Come, come to me With hands as pale as milk.

target: Bear me, good friends, where Cleopatra bides.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hurry up.
target: Dispatch.

target: I pray you, sir, what is he?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But my heart is still throbbing to know one thing.
target: Yet my heart Throbs to know one thing.

target: If that her breath will mist or stain the stone, Why then, she lives.

target: I lay with Cassio lately And, being troubled with a raging tooth, I could not sleep.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You do Stay, Please, tell me what you think of me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Now please leave me alone.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s a good thing I’m like a little pot and warm up quickly, or else my lips themselves would freeze and stick to my teeth, my tongue to the roof of my mouth, and my heart would freeze in my belly, before I managed to get thawed out.
target: Now, were not I a little pot and soon hot, my very lips might freeze to my teeth, my tongue to the roof of my mouth, my heart in my belly, ere I should come by a fire to thaw me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why should I be afraid of your judgment when I haven’t done anything wrong?
target: What judgment shall I dread, doing no wrong?

target: Follow the noise so far as we have quarter; Let’s see how it will give off.

target: Thou hast, Ventidius, that Without the which a soldier and his sword Grants scarce distinction.

target: Of Albany’s and Cornwall’s powers you heard not?

target: Oh, look!

target: Now, my lord, what shall we do, if we perceive Lord Hastings will not yield to our complots?

target: Why, then, take no note of him, but let him go and presently call the rest of the watch together and thank God you are rid of a knave.

target: There is no other way, Unless thou couldst put on some other shape And not be Richard, that hath done all this.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come, warble for me.

target: This morning are they fled away and gone, And in their steads do ravens, crows, and kites Fly o'er our heads and downward look on us As we were sickly prey.

target: Orlando doth commend him to you both, And to that youth he calls his Rosalind He sends this bloody napkin.

target: They are so still, Or thou, the greatest soldier of the world, Art turned the greatest liar.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let my sorrow have the upper hand.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Run and proclaim it in the streets.
target: Run hence, proclaim, cry it about the streets.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This is Illyria, lady.
target: This is Illyria, lady.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Coward!
target: Where’s thy drum?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Madam, hurry as fast as you can get out of my court.
target: Mistress, dispatch you with your safest haste, And get you from our court.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My heart, which dried out with grief, will surely break apart into a powder, and that will be the end of my disgusting mind.
target: Throw my heart Against the flint and hardness of my fault, Which, being dried with grief, will break to powder And finish all foul thoughts.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I don’t want to be cured, boy.
target: I would not be cured, youth.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This dream has been interpreted all wrong.
target: This dream is all amiss interpreted.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: By the end I will either live, or else I’ll restore my honor by shedding my blood.
target: Or I will live Or bathe my dying honor in the blood Shall make it live again.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Light the candles!
target: Strike on the tinder, ho!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you insist on trying my patience any further, then take out your sword right now.
target: If thou darest tempt me further, draw thy sword.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do as I tell you.
target: Do as I bid thee, go.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This is how the candle burned the moth.
target: Thus hath the candle singed the moth.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He was on his way here with your wife.
target: Come with my lady hither.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ve pierced me through the heart with your cruelty, and yet you, the murderer, look as bright and clear as a star in the sky.
target: Yet you, the murderer, look as bright, as clear, As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And that’s true too.
target: And that’s true too.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hurry, Messala, and I’ll look for Pindarus in the meantime.
target: Hie you, Messala, And I will seek for Pindarus the while.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Did she give up all those chances to marry noblemen, give up her father and country and friends, just to be called a whore?
target: Hath she forsook so many noble matches, Her father and her country, and her friends, To be called “whore”?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We hope you feel better and find some peace.
target: We wish your peace.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And now, let’s turn to our business with the French.
target: And now to our French causes.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We’ll listen to him.
target: We’ll hear him.—Noble Antony, go up.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Was that my father who left here in such a hurry?
target: Was that my father that went hence so fast?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do you have your answer yet?
target: What, are you answered yet?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He has, my lord.
target: He hath, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, my lord.
target: No, indeed, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please put up with my weakness.
target: Bear with my weakness.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Who’s there!
target: Who’s there?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes indeed.
target: Ay.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll follow the priest and go with you; and after I’ve sworn to be faithful, I’ll be faithful forever.
target: I’ll follow this good man, and go with you; And, having sworn truth, ever will be true.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hide behind the boxwood hedge, all three of you.
target: Get you all three into the boxtree.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let me go, or I’ll knock you on the head.
target: Let me go, sir, or I’ll knock you o'er the mazzard.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If they see you, they’ll murder you.
target: If they do see thee they will murder thee.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This hasn’t reached the level of an Egyptian feast yet.
target: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, and he’s been carried off the field.
target: Ay, and brought off the field.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But please tell me, who’s his best friend?
target: But I pray you, who is his companion?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Romeo!
target: Romeo!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hello, Tubal.
target: How now, Tubal?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Mistress, you have to go see your father.
target: Mistress, you must come away to your father.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Give me your hand.
target: Give me thy hand.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Leave out the water.
target: Cast on no water.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Can you bring me to him?
target: Canst thou bring me to th' party?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He doesn’t know he’s been appointed governor yet.
target: He knows not yet of his honorable fortune.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll bite my thumb at them.
target: I will bite my thumb at them, which is a disgrace to them, if they bear it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Quiet!
target: Yet hear me speak.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The whole world could look at you, and no one would be as blind as he is, thinking you’re beautiful.
target: Though all the world could see, None could be so abused in sight as he.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Who are you talking to?
target: Why do you speak, too, “Why blame you me to love you?”?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Messala!
target: Messala!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I saw her, but I didn’t notice her.
target: I noted her not, but I looked on her.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh do-de, do-de, do-de.
target: Oh, do-de, do-de, do-de.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That’s what the Prince and my fiancé say.
target: So says the Prince and my new-trothèd lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Damn you for teaching me your language!
target: The red plague rid you For learning me your language!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Take me to the man my husband is in debt to.
target: Bear me forthwith unto his creditor, And, knowing how the debt grows, I will pay it.— Good Master Doctor, see him safe conveyed Home to my house.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Did you go to bed so late, my friend, that you’re having a hard time getting up now?
target: Was it so late, friend, ere you went to bed, That you do lie so late?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You look like a person who knows the business of war.
target: Thou look’st like him that knows a warlike charge.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Where’s Publius?
target: Where’s Publius?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And you haven’t heard any news about her in your letters?
target: Nor nothing in your letters writ of her?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What we are is up to us.
target: Tis in ourselves that we are thus or thus.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please give me that.
target: Pray, give me that.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Sweet Montague, be true.
target: Dear love, adieu.— Anon, good Nurse!—Sweet Montague, be true.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: God, what a burden on you I must have been!
target: Alack, what trouble Was I then to you!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: For a full half hour.
target: Full half an hour.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And could you please take my servant to old Shylock’s house?
target: Furthermore, I pray you show my youth old Shylock’s house.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I didn’t think I would ever fight Pompey.
target: I did not think to draw my sword ’gainst Pompey, For he hath laid strange courtesies and great Of late upon me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, my lord.
target: Ay, good my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: God gives those gifts—I had nothing to do with it.
target: Gifts that God gives.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Tomorrow, I’ll let you know what I’ve decided and what answer you should deliver to the king of England.
target: Tomorrow shall you bear our full intent Back to our brother England.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You saw eternity in my lips and eyes, and happiness in the arch of my eyebrows.
target: Eternity was in our lips and eyes, Bliss in our brows’ bent, none our parts so poor But was a race of heaven.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And you, go call my fool.
target: Go you, call hither my fool.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Make these men work.
target: Play the men.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s strange that Regan and her husband left their house without sending back my messenger.
target: Tis strange that they should so depart from home, And not send back my messenger.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Dinner is over, and we’re going to get there too late.
target: Supper is done, and we shall come too late.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Too bad it’s spoiling our pleasure tonight.
target: Our duties, and the pledge.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Are you good at those kinds of things?
target: Art thou good at these kickshawses, knight?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Pray God does some surgery on you: you need to be fixed.
target: God make incision in thee; thou art raw.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The nobleman’s are as huge as the underfed villager’s.
target: The noblest deer hath them as huge as the rascal.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We’re done for!
target: To prayers, to prayers, all lost!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Were these things we’re talking about really here?
target: Were such things here as we do speak about?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That your interest payments are like Jacob’s sheep?
target: Or is your gold and silver ewes and rams?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Antonio, oh my dear Antonio!
target: Antonio, O my dear Antonio!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I have an aunt who is a widow, who’s very rich and doesn’t have any children.
target: I have a widow aunt, a dowager Of great revenue, and she hath no child.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, let’s hope you stay in that noble frame of mind.
target: God keep your Lordship in that gracious mind.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But Lysander’s so attractive that he’s turned heaven into hell!
target: Oh, then, what graces in my love do dwell, That he hath turned a heaven unto a hell!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is there anything else you wish?
target: Look you for any other issue?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m not sure I can wait that long.
target: Ay, it stands so that I may hardly tarry so long.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come here, man.
target: Come hither, fellow.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Would he have snuck away from me while I was asleep?
target: Would he have stolen away From sleeping Hermia?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ve connived to steal my daughter’s heart, making her stubborn and harsh instead of obedient (like she should be).—And, my gracious duke, if she won’t agree to marry Demetrius right now, I ask you to let me exercise the right that all fathers have in Athens.
target: With cunning hast thou filched my daughter’s heart, Turned her obedience (which is due to me) To stubborn harshness.—And, my gracious duke, Be it so she will not here before your grace Consent to marry with Demetrius, I beg the ancient privilege of Athens.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is this well done?
target: Is this well done?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Then Desdemona and Othello will go back to Venice.
target: Why, then Othello and Desdemona return again to Venice.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s getting late.
target: The hour steals on.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please, do so.
target: I prithee, do so.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I had to send it to him.
target: I was enforced to send it after him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But I have a legitimate son a few years older than this one, and I don’t love him any more than I love my bastard.
target: But I have, sir, a son by order of law, some year older than this, who yet is no dearer in my account.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, I do, lady.
target: That I have, lady.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This isn’t the death of one man.
target: The death of Antony Is not a single doom.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: She’ll fall madly in love with the first thing she sees when she wakes up—even if it’s a lion, a bear, a wolf, a bull, a monkey, or an ape.
target: The next thing then she waking looks upon— Be it on lion, bear, or wolf, or bull, On meddling monkey or on busy ape— She shall pursue it with the soul of love.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And let no one suffer for this deed except us, the perpetrators.
target: And let no man abide this deed But we the doers.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh I hope that’s not true!
target: Marry, heaven forbid!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Haven’t I resisted even Brutus, begging from his knees?
target: Doth not Brutus bootless kneel?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do you remember the circumstances?
target: You do remember all the circumstance?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: So were you.
target: So were you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ve got some business to take care of.
target: I have some business.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Not offensive at all.
target: No offense i' th' world.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: A very candid reply.
target: Roundly replied.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Tonight she is shut up in her room, alone with her sadness.
target: Tonight she is mewed up to her heaviness.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Launcelot and I can’t agree on anything.
target: Launcelot and I are out.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Therefore, you should obey their wishes.
target: Then let your will attend on their accords.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hello and God bless you, sir.
target: God bless you, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ll “never trust his word again.” Come on, that was a stupid thing to say.
target: You’ll “never trust his word after.” Come, ’tis a foolish saying.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Can we have some water please here?— Come and wash, Kate, make yourself at home.
target: Shall I have some water?— Come, Kate, and wash, and welcome heartily.— You whoreson villain!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But whenever you feel a larger pain, the smaller one disappears.
target: But where the greater malady is fixed The lesser is scarce felt.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your mistress sent for me to come to dinner?
target: Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why did you send me out, brave Cassius?
target: Why didst thou send me forth, brave Cassius?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’re absolutely right, your highness.
target: Thou dost talk nothing to me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The captain—give it to the captain.
target: The captain— Give it the captain.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Go back with her?
target: Return with her?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Give me your love instead, as I give you mine.
target: Your loves, as mine to you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your name’s Gloucester.
target: Thy name is Gloucester.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, every inch a king.
target: Ay, every inch a king.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ve always been straightforward with you, so now I’m telling you what I think.
target: I was always plain with you, and so now I speak my agitation of the matter.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Stand still.
target: Stand still.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Tell Antony that Brutus has been taken.
target: Tell Antony Brutus is ta'en.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The king has strictly forbidden it.
target: The king hath strictly charged the contrary.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Hurry.
target: Post-post-haste, dispatch.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ve probably heard about the “change” that’s come over Hamlet—that’s the only word for it, since inside and out he’s different from what he was before.
target: Something have you heard Of Hamlet’s “transformation”—so call it Since nor th' exterior nor the inward man Resembles that it was.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The only reason you left India was to come here and see that butch Amazon Hippolyta.
target: Why art thou here, Come from the farthest step of India?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Some say the lark makes a sweet division between day and night.
target: Some say the lark makes sweet division.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You represented yourself as just a common man.
target: You appeared to me but as a common man.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Will it never be morning?
target: Will it never be morning?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do so.
target: Do so.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Meet with the ambassadors.
target: Hear the ambassadors.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Before I could break up the fight, Tybalt was killed.
target: But by and by comes back to Romeo, Who had but newly entertained revenge, And to ’t they go like lightning, for ere I Could draw to part them was stout Tybalt slain.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: More and more light.
target: More light and light it grows.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: After you, sir.
target: Not I, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Lovely, most lovely Katherine, will you agree to teach a soldier the words that would recommend his love-suit to a gentle heart like yours?
target: Fair Katherine, and most fair, Will you vouchsafe to teach a soldier terms Such as will enter at a lady’s ear And plead his love suit to her gentle heart?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Borachio.
target: Borachio.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No words can express the pain.
target: No words can that woe sound.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I gave it to Dromio, who rushed in for it.
target: Alas, I sent you money to redeem you By Dromio here, who came in haste for it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This king is a branch of that same victorious stock.
target: This is a stem Of that victorious stock, and let us fear The native mightiness and fate of him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll cry at nothing, and I’ll always do it when you’re in a good mood.
target: I will weep for nothing, like Diana in the fountain, and I will do that when you are disposed to be merry.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I couldn’t bear to obey all of your daughters' harsh orders.
target: My duty cannot suffer To obey in all your daughters' hard commands.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: There’s a fool sharing my bed now.
target: My fool usurps my body.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My back aches too—
target: Ah, my back, my back!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I could drown the world.
target: All springs reduce their currents to mine eyes, That I, being governed by the watery moon, May send forth plenteous tears to drown the world.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do you know the way to Dover?
target: Know’st thou the way to Dover?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I have more news too.
target: I could tell you more news too.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Fire!
target: Arms, arms, sword, fire, corruption in the place!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is he really married?
target: He is married?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Adultery?
target: Adultery?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Rome has lost the ability to raise noble men!
target: Rome, thou hast lost the breed of noble bloods!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’re a poor man if you’re this impatient!
target: How poor are they that have not patience!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Was it you that he rescued?
target: Was ’t you he rescued?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The day is well on its way.
target: The day is spent.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I saw it with my own eyes.
target: They did so, to th' amazement of mine eyes That looked upon ’t.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Malvolio’s coming down the path.
target: Malvolio’s coming down this walk.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The only glory princes have are their titles.
target: Princes have but their titles for their glories, An outward honor for an inward toil,

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Wait, here’s a penny to heal your head.
target: Hold you, there is a groat to heal your pate.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Don’t swear at all.
target: Do not swear at all.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Do you work in this house?
target: Art of this house?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And yet you’re the one who wants to teach me about restraint!
target: And yet thou wilt tutor me from quarreling!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: They got what they deserved.
target: Their defeat Does by their own insinuation grow.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come with me tonight, and you’ll see a man enter her bedroom chamber—even tonight, the night before her wedding.
target: Go but with me tonight, you shall see her chamber window entered, even the night before her wedding day.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What, are you going to mock me to my face when I told you not to?
target: What, wilt thou flout me thus unto my face, Being forbid?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Enough!
target: Some must go off.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You say you don’t know what the girl thinks.
target: You say you do not know the lady’s mind.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good man, why are you crying?
target: Good heart, at what?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, so cruel!
target: O cruel!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If I could get my hands on you, I’d make you care.
target: If I had thee in Lipsbury pinfold, I would make thee care for me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you want to go to hell, there are better ways to do it than killing yourself.
target: If thou wilt needs damn thyself, do it a more delicate way than drowning.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I won’t be gone long.
target: I will not be long from you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And I know that unless the law intervenes, it’ll be bad news for poor Antonio.
target: And I know, my lord, If law, authority, and power deny not, It will go hard with poor Antonio.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Who does time amble for?
target: Who ambles time withal?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you make the accusation convincingly, then my cunning won’t fail me.
target: Be you constant in the accusation, and my cunning shall not shame me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Did I do anything good to myself?
target: For any good That I myself have done unto myself?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why not?
target: Your reason?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I swear that Claudio will pay dearly for this.
target: By this hand, Claudio shall render me a dear account.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let’s get out of here.
target: Oh, let us hence.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Will you play this recorder?
target: Will you play upon this pipe?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, I must let them find me.
target: Not I, I must be found.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He loves Caesar best, but he also loves Antony.
target: But he loves Caesar best; yet he loves Antony.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ll see that Caesar is giving you no reason to do so.
target: You do extend These thoughts of horror further than you shall Find cause in Caesar.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Where will the old duke live?
target: Where will the old duke live?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Three-time traitor and whore!
target: Triple-turned whore!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Listen, Signor Bassanio, there’s nothing to worry about.
target: Signor Bassanio, hear me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Lock the door.
target: Ho, let the door be locked.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is it time, my Lord Constable?
target: Now, my Lord Constable?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He’s wearing yellow stockings.
target: He’s in yellow stockings.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The wine of life has been poured out, and only the dregs remain.
target: The wine of life is drawn, and the mere lees Is left this vault to brag of.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That’s why there must be space between you.
target: Therefore Make space enough between you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Then do so, with all your heart.
target: And do it with all thy heart.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No.
target: No.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I am nothing but a poor, used fool.
target: Poor I am but his stale.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Our forces are ready for them.
target: Our preparation stands In expectation of them.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good day, Lieutenant Bardolph.
target: Good morrow, Lieutenant Bardolph.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Still the same old Cassius!
target: Old Cassius still.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Are you afraid to act the way you desire?
target: Art thou afeard To be the same in thine own act and valor As thou art in desire?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Wake up when something nasty is nearby.
target: Wake when some vile thing is near.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: So you’re around Lady Luck’s waist?
target: Then you live about her waist, or in the middle of her favors?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s my daughter!
target: My daughter!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good morning, old Sir Thomas Erpingham!
target: Good morrow, old Sir Thomas Erpingham.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why, he has an income of three thousand ducats a year.
target: Why, he has three thousand ducats a year.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: So, by heaven’s decree, Rosalind Was composed Of different faces, eyes, and hearts, so that she might have the most prized touches of all.
target: Thus Rosalind of many parts By heavenly synod was devised, Of many faces, eyes, and hearts To have the touches dearest prized.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The devil must be behind this.
target: Against all rules of nature, and must be driven To find out practices of cunning hell Why this should be.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No one will listen to it.
target: There’s few or none will entertain it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let life be short so that shame won’t last too long.
target: Let life be short, else shame will be too long.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What, isn’t my mother coming?
target: What, will our mother come?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: With my eye sockets?
target: What, with the case of eyes?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, you won’t die yourself, but only by proxy.
target: No, faith, die by attorney.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: For assuredly, you are so near the abyss that you’re bound to be swallowed up.
target: For certainly thou art so near the gulf Thou needs must be englutted.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m sure of that.
target: I am sure of that.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: How can it seem like I’m making fun of you, when my tears prove that I’m sincere?
target: How can these things in me seem scorn to you, Bearing the badge of faith to prove them true?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I would, my boy.
target: It does, my boy.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If I may say so, your Majesty, your famous grandfather and your great-uncle Edward, the Black Prince of Wales—or so I’ve read in the history books—fought a very brave battle here in France.
target: Your grandfather of famous memory, an’t please your Majesty, and your great-uncle Edward the Plack Prince of Wales, as I have read in the chronicles, fought a most prave pattle here in France.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Sir, sir, calm down.
target: Sir, sir, be patient.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That’s why they say love is a child.
target: And therefore is Love said to be a child, Because in choice he is so oft beguiled.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll make Oliver find him.
target: I’ll make him find him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Thank the lord for alliances!
target: Good Lord for alliance!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ll introduce me to him as a eunuch.
target: Thou shall present me as an eunuch to him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My wife’s coming.
target: My wife is coming yonder.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Finally the new moon, curved like a silver bow in the sky, will look down on our wedding celebration.
target: And then the moon, like to a silver bow New bent in heaven, shall behold the night Of our solemnities.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I hear him mock Caesar’s luck, which the gods give to men in order to balance out their subsequent wrath.
target: I hear him mock The luck of Caesar, which the gods give men To excuse their after wrath.—Husband, I come!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, now I really need that priest who spoke to me today!
target: O, now I need the priest that spake to me!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Can we go?
target: May we be gone?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, I’ll prove it with airtight evidence and logical argument.
target: I will prove it legitimate, sir, upon the oaths of judgment and reason.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But come, my lord, let’s go.
target: But come, my lord, let’s away.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Madam, you’ve treated me badly, very badly.
target: Madam, you have done me wrong, Notorious wrong.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Brother John Bates, isn’t that dawn breaking over there?
target: Brother John Bates, is not that the morning which breaks yonder?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Lead them inside.
target: Take them in.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Could you really do such a thing, for all the world?
target: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Go, get out!
target: Go, get thee hence.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I am being serious, my lord.
target: If you swear, my lord, you shall not be forsworn.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But do you really think the Prince would treat you that way?
target: But did you think the Prince would have served you thus?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But when push comes to shove, they droop like those horses that are all show and slow to a crawl.
target: But when they should endure the bloody spur, They fall their crests and, like deceitful jades, Sink in the trial.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you can shape up, you’re welcome to stay in the house.
target: If you can separate yourself and your misdemeanors, you are welcome to the house.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Bring them to me.
target: Bring them before us.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Even though I don’t see it, this lady thinks I’m a marvelously good-looking man.
target: Upon my life, she finds, although I cannot, Myself to be a marv'lous proper man.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh Setebos, these are handsome spirits!
target: O Setebos, these be brave spirits indeed!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Release me So I can return to my dukedom With your help.
target: Let me not, Since I have my dukedom got And pardoned the deceiver, dwell In this bare island by your spell, But release me from my bands With the help of your good hands.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Haven’t you totally dismissed my honor and integrity in your anger?
target: Have you not set mine honor at the stake, And baited it with all the unmuzzled thoughts That tyrannous heart can think?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Ever since Venus and her blind son plotted a way for the god of the underworld to steal my daughter away for half the year, I swore I’d never speak to them again.
target: Since they did plot The means that dusky Dis my daughter got, Her and her blind boy’s scandaled company I have forsworn.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Because we were unprepared for the king’s visit, we weren’t able to entertain him as well as we would have wanted to.
target: Being unprepared, Our will became the servant to defect, Which else should free have wrought.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Welcome.
target: Welcome.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Would you like some more sauce to go with it?
target: Will you have some more sauce to your leek?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your wives, your daughters, your old women, and your young maids together could not satisfy my lust.
target: Your wives, your daughters, Your matrons, and your maids could not fill up The cistern of my lust, and my desire All continent impediments would o'erbear That did oppose my will.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, here comes the storm again.
target: Alas, the storm is come again!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Should I get your nightgown?
target: Shall I go fetch your nightgown?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Welcome back!
target: Most welcome home!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, let’s hope your good fortune continues!
target: God hold it, to your Honor’s good content!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, don’t worry about it—we’ll dip your    I’ll get you for that one.
target: Tush, fear not, man.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: In suicide, gods allow tyrants to be defeated.
target: Therein, ye gods, you tyrants do defeat.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s difficult to bring two friends together, but even mountains can be moved together by earthquakes.
target: O Lord, Lord, it is a hard matter for friends to meet, but mountains may be removed with earthquakes and so encounter.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I love my master, and he’ll find me very hard-working.
target: Now, banished Kent, If thou canst serve where thou dost stand condemned, So may it come thy master, whom thou lovest, Shall find thee full of labors.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What an awful day!
target: Alack the day!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Leave all the rest to me.
target: Leave all the rest to me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He looks angry.
target: With his eyes full of anger.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Beware of jealousy, my lord!
target: Oh, beware, my lord, of jealousy!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll fight every one of these devils if I have to, one at a time.
target: But one fiend at a time, I’ll fight their legions o'er.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The other voice is harsh and abusive.
target: His backward voice is to utter foul speeches and to detract.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Get out of here.
target: Get thee gone.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I don’t know, and he won’t tell me.
target: I neither know it nor can learn of him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, I won’t cry any more.
target: No, I will weep no more.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You defend yourself by blaming my judgment, but you’re just making up feeble excuses.
target: You praise yourself By laying defects of judgment to me, but You patched up your excuses.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Look how flushed the actor is, with tears in his eyes.
target: Look whe'e he has not turned his color and has tears in ’s eyes.—Prithee, no more.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You and I, and honest Casca, we have epilepsy—we’ve fallen.
target: But you and I And honest Casca, we have the falling sickness.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is the snake better than the eel because the pattern on his back pleases the eye?
target: Or is the adder better than the eel Because his painted skin contents the eye?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, that’s certainly out of this world, all right.
target: Indeed, that is out of the air.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Then sure ones.
target: Sure ones, then.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I won’t be hit, my lord.
target: I’ll not be strucken, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But I must go there, against my will: servants must fulfill their masters' wishes.
target: Thither I must, although against my will, For servants must their masters' minds fulfill.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And like I am for Ganymede.
target: And I for Ganymede.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Only he acted from honesty and for the general good.
target: He only in a general honest thought And common good to all, made one of them.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, I wish I could know what will happen today before it happens!
target: Oh, that a man might know The end of this day’s business ere it come!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Are the others waiting?
target: Am I not stayed for?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: That’s true, sir.
target: True, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He’s welcome too.
target: He is welcome too.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Sir, be a man.
target: Good sir, be a man, Think every bearded fellow that’s but yoked May draw with you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: A sword’s too heavy for you to wear.
target: It is too heavy for your Grace to wear.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: There’s not a strand of feather left in our whole army—a good sign, I hope, that we won’t fly away like birds—and time on the field has made us slovenly.
target: There’s not a piece of feather in our host— Good argument, I hope, we will not fly— And time hath worn us into slovenry.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This forest doesn’t seem deserted when you’re here, because you are all the world to me.
target: Nor doth this wood lack worlds of company, For you in my respect are all the world.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, grief has transformed me since the last time you saw me.
target: O, grief hath changed me since you saw me last, And careful hours with time’s deformèd hand Have written strange defeatures in my face.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Let go of me!
target: Hence!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Your fall has left a blot that opens even the best and brightest to suspicion.
target: And thus thy fall hath left a kind of blot To mark the full-fraught man and best endued With some suspicion.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Get up.
target: Arise.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Now, madam, undress and come to bed.
target: Madam, undress you and come now to bed.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Shut up, you doddering old wizard!
target: Peace, doting wizard, peace.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: This fake astonishment of yours is just like your other pranks.
target: This admiration, sir, is much o' th' savor Of other your new pranks.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh what a curse marriage is!
target: Oh, curse of marriage That we can call these delicate creatures ours And not their appetites!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We heard it very clearly.
target: It struck mine ear most terribly.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Fierce, fiery warriors fought in the clouds in the usual formations of war—ranks and squadrons—until the clouds drizzled blood onto the Capitol.
target: Fierce fiery warriors fought upon the clouds In ranks and squadrons and right form of war, Which drizzled blood upon the Capitol.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is your name Goneril?
target: Is your name Goneril?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I see Regan and Goneril in hell—A thousand hissing devils with sizzling red pitchforks come up to them!
target: To have a thousand with red burning spits Come hissing in upon 'em!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What a pretty picture, three fools all together.
target: Did you never see the picture of “We Three”?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: So do you take her or leave her?
target: Sir, will you, with those infirmities she owes— Unfriended, new adopted to our hate, Dowered with our curse and strangered with our oath— Take her or leave her?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If that’s the case, tears wash my eyes more than hers.
target: If so, my eyes are oftener washed than hers.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ve gotten it dirty—ashes to ashes, and dust to dust.
target: Let it work, For ’tis the sport to have the engineer Hoist with his own petard.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You, fellow, step out of the crowd.
target: Fellow, come from the throng.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: They made him drink the leftover wine usually given to the poor.
target: They have made him drink alms-drink.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Have you mangled my tongue so badly in these seven short years that my only son can no longer recognize my weak, sorrow-ravaged voice?
target: O time’s extremity, Hast thou so crack’d and splitted my poor tongue In seven short years that here my only son Knows not my feeble key of untuned cares?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Thank you, brave Cassio.
target: I thank you, valiant Cassio.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I sent the king’s son off by himself to a faraway nook on the island, where he’s sitting now sighing, with his arms crossed like this.
target: The king’s son have I landed by himself, Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs In an odd angle of the isle, and sitting, His arms in this sad knot.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s a nice hand, an open one.
target: Tis a good hand, A frank one.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Pretty York, who told you about his teeth?
target: I prithee, pretty York, who told thee this?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We’ll all join hands and sing, and bless this place with our fairy grace.
target: Hand in hand with fairy grace Will we sing and bless this place.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Now that’s patience!
target: Patience unmoved!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Sing us a song.
target: Now let’s have a catch.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good-bye.
target: Farewell.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes, that one.
target: Faith, e'en with losing his wits.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m putting myself in God’s hands, and with his help I plan to fight against the secret plot that caused this treasonous murder.
target: In the great hand of God I stand, and thence Against the undivulged pretense I fight Of treasonous malice.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And if he fails at that, he will find other ways to kill you.
target: If he fail of that, He will have other means to cut you off.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My lord, I have some mementos of yours that I’ve been meaning to give back to you for a long time now.
target: My lord, I have remembrances of yours That I have longèd long to redeliver.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: How are you, my ladies?
target: How do you, women?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Authority.
target: Authority.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What, is trusting a friend such a crime?
target: Wilt thou make a trust a transgression?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, I’m such a coward for living long enough to see my best friend taken before my eyes!
target: Oh, coward that I am, to live so long To see my best friend ta'en before my face!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: One of our ships has reported that it saw most of their fleet shipwrecked.
target: A noble ship of Venice Hath seen a grievous wreck and sufferance On most part of their fleet.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Benvolio is part of the Montague family.
target: This is the truth, or let Benvolio die.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’d rather have a handful or two of dried peas.
target: I had rather have a handful or two of dried peas.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It’s some meteor coming out of the sun to light your way to Mantua.
target: It is some meteor that the sun exhales To be to thee this night a torchbearer, And light thee on thy way to Mantua.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: As a matter of fact, if the playwright had played Pyramus and hanged himself with Thisbe’s belt, it would have been a very good tragedy.
target: Marry, if he that writ it had played Pyramus and hanged himself in Thisbe’s garter, it would have been a fine tragedy.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m happy to say “amen” to that!
target: Happily, amen!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But tell me what you’re fighting about.
target: Speak yet.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Anyway, what’s up?
target: What news?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Which one of them did it?
target: Which is the villain?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My grandmother told me he was murdered there.
target: My grandam told me he was murdered there.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Be silent, or else my magic spell will be broken.
target: Hush and be mute, Or else our spell is marred.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: It was yesterday, your highness.
target: It was, so please your highness.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Can you feel your legs?
target: Feel you your legs?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I won’t take it back.
target: I’ll none of it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I saw her face as she walked with her brother and Mark Antony.
target: I looked her in the face, and saw her led Between her brother and Mark Antony.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ve been tricked.
target: I am mightily abused.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: One of them is too much like a painting of a man—he never speaks—and the other is too much like a spoiled little boy, always chattering.
target: The one is too like an image and says nothing, and the other too like my lady’s eldest son, evermore tattling.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Will you come with me?
target: Come, will you go with me?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come, husband, let’s go to lunch.
target: Come, sir, to dinner.—Dromio, keep the gate.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Meanwhile, thank you for your efforts.
target: Meantime we thank you for your well-took labor.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, evil, evil!
target: Oh, villainy, villainy!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come on, niece, I’m sure you love him.
target: Come, cousin, I am sure you love the gentleman.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Early in the morning I’ll go visit Desdemona and plead my case.
target: I think it freely, and betimes in the morning I will beseech the virtuous Desdemona to undertake for me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, Brutus, you’re noble.
target: Well, Brutus, thou art noble.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The ones you’ve sent our lunatic king to.
target: To whose hands You have sent the lunatic king.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: She’s not even fourteen.
target: She’s not fourteen.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Sometimes I’ll turn into fire!
target: Sometime a horse I’ll be, sometime a hound, A hog, a headless bear, sometime a fire.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If he cannot, let the tailor mend him.
target: If he cannot, let the botcher mend him.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, Ophelia, I’m bad at poetry.
target: O dear Ophelia, I am ill at these numbers.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And when is he leaving?
target: And when goes hence?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You did.
target: You did.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Something’s wrong.
target: All is not well.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Everyone except the sailors dove into the sea, leaving behind the ship that I had set on fire.
target: All but mariners Plunged in the foaming brine and quit the vessel, Then all afire with me.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, let it strike ten then.
target: Well, let it strike.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Well, Juliet, I’ll lie with you tonight.
target: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee tonight.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Noses, ears, lips.
target: Noses, ears, and lips.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I always loved you.
target: I loved you ever.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Don’t give him time to catch his breath.
target: Give him no breath, but now Make boot of his distraction.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Is  Would your Mightiness care to wash his hands?
target: Will ’t please your Mightiness to wash your hands?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: These two people are as identical as two halves of an apple.
target: An apple, cleft in two, is not more twin Than these two creatures.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You’ve described a warm friend who’s cooling off.
target: Thou hast described A hot friend cooling.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I won’t speak to her.
target: I will do ’t, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: As sane as me?
target: But as well?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I have a good eye, uncle.
target: I have a good eye, uncle.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Please just listen.
target: Thou know’st ’tis common.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The nasty devil’s biting my butt.
target: The foul fiend bites my back.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I once wrote a sonnet in his praise which began, “Wonder of nature—” I have heard a sonnet to one’s mistress that began like that.
target: I once writ a sonnet in his praise and began thus: “Wonder of nature—”  I have heard a sonnet begin so to one’s mistress.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: The next day we had our fight at sea, and you know what happened after that.
target: Now, the next day Was our sea fight, and what to this was sequent Thou know’st already.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But I never spoke the whole time?
target: But did I never speak of all that time?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Come on, my lord.
target: Come, my lord.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: How smooth and cool they seem!
target: They shall be apprehended by and by.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Octavius, I’m older than you are.
target: Octavius, I have seen more days than you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Speak softly.
target: Speak softly.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Isn’t there any other rite you can perform?
target: Must there no more be done?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Which one of you is the lady of the house?
target: The honorable lady of the house, which is she?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: When powerful kings cave in to flatterers, do you think loyal men will be afraid to speak out against it?
target: Think’st thou that duty shall have dread to speak When power to flattery bows?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: And Cassius too.
target: And Cassius too.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He’s walking ahead of me, and he keeps daring me to follow him.
target: He goes before me and still dares me on.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, really?
target: Indeed?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Madam, keep up hope.
target: Madam, good hope.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Wasn’t that letter from Jessica?
target: Was not that letter from fair Jessica?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Buckingham, I need to have a word with you.
target: Cousin of Buckingham, a word with you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You should ask me what time of day it is, instead.
target: You should ask me what time o' day.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You can’t tell a story simply when it’s a lie.
target: Plain and not honest is too harsh a style.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But how strange that Beatrice should seem to know who I was and yet not know at the same time.
target: But that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not know me!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You smiled with a strength you must have gotten from heaven, while I cried salty tears into the salty sea, and groaned at our situation.
target: Thou didst smile Infusèd with a fortitude from heaven, When I have decked the sea with drops full salt, Under my burthen groaned; which raised in me An undergoing stomach to bear up Against what should ensue.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: We’re men beached on the sand, hoping to be washed out by the next tide.
target: Even as men wracked upon a sand, that look to be washed off the next tide.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What, does the news only get worse?—Please, Bassanio, I’m half of you, so let me bear half the burden this letter brings you.
target: What, worse and worse?— With leave, Bassanio, I am half yourself, And I must freely have the half of anything That this same paper brings you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Maybe I should ask you what right you have to take me, but I’ll take you, Orlando, to be my husband.
target: I might ask you for your commission, but I do take thee, Orlando, for my husband.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: A likely story!
target: A proper saying!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: He does hear me, and that makes me cry.
target: He does hear me, And that he does I weep.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: But it’s enough to know that the day will end, and then the end will be known.
target: But it sufficeth that the day will end, And then the end is known.—Come, ho!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: A king, perhaps— My lord— How is it that the prophet didn’t tell me at the time that I would kill him?
target: A king, perhaps— My lord— How chance the prophet could not at that time Have told me, I being by, that I should kill him?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I think you’re my mirror, not my brother.
target: Methinks you are my glass, and not my brother: I see by you I am a sweet-faced youth.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’ll go straight for that proverb with “To hell with the devil.” You are better at proverbs than I am by as much as “A fool shoots quickly and overshoots his mark.” You have overshot.
target: Have at the very eye of that proverb with “A pox of the devil.”  You are the better at proverbs, by how much “A fool’s bolt is soon shot.”  You have shot over.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: No, the one I gave you.
target: That which I gave you.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: What’s that paper you were reading?
target: What paper were you reading?

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh, I wish I could make a  My soul is calling out my name.
target: Bondage is hoarse, and may not speak aloud, Else would I tear the cave where Echo lies, And make her airy tongue more hoarse than mine, With repetition of “My Romeo!” It is my soul that calls upon my name.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Why, what a complicated case this is!
target: Why, what an intricate impeach is this!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: I’m killing myself with this provocative speculation . . .
target: Now I feed myself With most delicious poison.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Don’t worry about me not swearing enough.
target: Nay, let me alone for swearing.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You had rotten food, and he helped you eat it.
target: You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Naked,” he says.
target: Seafaring men, sir.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: My father’s studying hard, so he won’t see you.
target: My father Is hard at study.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: If you were a woman, I’d hug you now and cry, and say “Welcome back, drowned Viola!” My father had a mole on his forehead.
target: Were you a woman, as the rest goes even, I should my tears let fall upon your cheek And say “Thrice-welcome, drownèd Viola!” My father had a mole upon his brow.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Oh Lord, they’re fighting!
target: O Lord, they fight!

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Yes.
target: Ay.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: You see how naïve and foolish I’ve been.
target: You see how simple and how fond I am.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Good thinking.
target: Well thought upon.

source: Rewrite in Shakespearean style: Gentlemanly manners have more sway around here than force does.
